channel.title: Christmas, Christian or Family?
channel.description: Alot of people now a-days associate everything having to do with christmas, with Christianity and other religions. However a similar amount of people think of Christmas as having nothing to do with religion and its all family centered. Thoughts?

item.title: Christmas, Christian or Family?
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

I think as I’m getting older I’m starting to enjoy Christmas more for the family good times (drinking) and less for the gifts, as I can’t really think of anything I want.

I do like the gift giving and receiving part though, just our family doesn’t go over the top with it.

Read full topic

item.title: Christmas, Christian or Family?
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

I associate christmas with time off school, nothing else. We don’t celebrate christmas cos we don’t support commercial holidays or christian faggotry.

Read full topic

item.title: Christmas, Christian or Family?
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:18, topic:250671”]Christ + Mas

Christ (Heyzus) + Motoscafo Armato Silurante (Italian: “Torpedo Armed Motorboat”) commonly abbreviated as MAS)

Celebrating the creation of the best arsenal of all. Jesus on the torpedo armed motorboat.[/quote]hahahahahahahahahahaha

NOT FUCKING FUNNY

item.title: Christmas, Christian or Family?
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

Christ + Mas

Christ (Heyzus) + Motoscafo Armato Silurante (Italian: “Torpedo Armed Motorboat”) commonly abbreviated as MAS)

Celebrating the creation of the best arsenal of all. Jesus on the torpedo armed motorboat.

[quote=“jme, post:12, topic:250671”]I’m not getting anything this year because my parents hate me.

Christmas is fucking dumb, I get so sick of it by the end of december.[/quote]You’re just being crabby because you aren’t getting anything.

I’m not getting anything either. Well, I didn’t ask for anything, although my parents mentioned that they didn’t get much. I just look forward to the break and getting together with the family.

Read full topic

item.title: Christmas, Christian or Family?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“PaulT, post:16, topic:250671”]Historically Christ was born in midsummer and Christmas (Yule) is a pagan holiday celebrating the sun-god on the winter solstice…But don’t let that stop you from buying more cheap plastic crap!!!

Yes, the Germans invented Christmas and the gas-chamber, and Americans have only aerosol deodorant and the atomic bomb to brag about. Shit. Well, at least we have our “Family Values”. Guns and butter! Death and Taxes![/quote]

Germanic peoples are not limited to Germans. I live in the Netherlands, or Fryslan to be exact. Frisians are German people, but they have nothing to do with Germans from Germany. Where ‘Deutschland’ is Germany, ‘Germanen’ are Germanic people.

Read full topic

item.title: Christmas, Christian or Family?
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Historically Christ was born in midsummer and Christmas (Yule) is a pagan holiday celebrating the sun-god on the winter solstice…But don’t let that stop you from buying more cheap plastic crap!!!

Yes, the Germans invented Christmas and the gas-chamber, and Americans have only aerosol deodorant and the atomic bomb to brag about. Shit. Well, at least we have our “Family Values”. Guns and butter! Death and Taxes!

item.title: Christmas, Christian or Family?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

In Europe we celebrate Christmas a bit different, although it’s starting to resemble the American way. We, at least my family, just gets together and have a big meal. Everyone makes a part of the meal. We don’t give gifts.

Read full topic

item.title: Christmas, Christian or Family?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

I’m not getting anything this year because my parents hate me.

Christmas is fucking dumb, I get so sick of it by the end of december.

This year, christmas is more about friends to me. I live in a small town and most of my friends have moved away to the cities for college and university, and they are all coming home for christmas so I’m looking forward to it, some are home already.

Read full topic

item.title: Christmas, Christian or Family?
item.dc:creator: @_Worx `Worx
item.description:
@_Worx wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:5, topic:250671”][quote author=`Worx link=topic=330674.msg2582980#msg2582980 date=1229320877]
On the 25’th of December, the 3 Wise Men visited Baby Jesus in a manager following the Star of David.
[/quote]

Actually, nobody has the slightest clue when Christ was born. We chose the 25th December as a totally arbitrary day because it was offset against the other celebrations of the time.[/quote]

Really? I actually never knew that. Thanks for info.

Read full topic

personally, i agree with yakman.[/quote]
ull be th 1 crying wen santa dosnt com.

Honestly, we wont know if god is a lie… one way to find out, and that is to die for a few minutes. Repeatedly.

item.title: Christmas, Christian or Family?
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

On the 25th of december a savior was born.
He revealed the truth, bringing joy to millions,
He amazed the world with his superior understanding and control of nature.
He changed history forever,
His work remains as relevant today as it was in his own time.

and his name was Isaac Newton!

Happy Newton Day!

Read full topic

item.title: Christmas, Christian or Family?
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

Actually, the Romans made it Dec 25th because when converting from Paganism to Christianity they also changed their celebration, replacing their Pagan celebration (Dec 25th) with Christmas. At least that’s what I’ve been taught.

Read full topic

item.title: Christmas, Christian or Family?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

`Worx:

On the 25’th of December, the 3 Wise Men visited Baby Jesus in a manager following the Star of David.

Actually, nobody has the slightest clue when Christ was born. We chose the 25th December as a totally arbitrary day because it was offset against the other celebrations of the time.

Read full topic

item.title: Christmas, Christian or Family?
item.dc:creator: @_Worx `Worx
item.description:
@_Worx wrote:

xxxxxx 13:

Alot of people now a-days associate everything having to do with christmas, with Christianity and other religions. However a similar amount of people think of Christmas as having nothing to do with religion and its all family centered. Thoughts?

No, this is not so. Christmas is technically the celebration of the birth of Jesus Christ. On the 25’th of December, the 3 Wise Men visited Baby Jesus in a manager following the Star of David.

The presents and other faggotry around this time are by-products of society.

Read full topic

very insightful, but yah thats not necessarily where it comes from. His name wasnt Jesus Christ, He was Jesus the son of god, He was Christ i forget the translation of that from hebrew but i believe it goes back to the root of savior. So not necessarily.
